Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin: Appearing for the Government, Timothy Henwood, for defendant, Fernando Carlo and PTO, Eddebbie Cofresi.Initial Appearance as to Jose David Figueroa-Agosto held on 11/22/2010: COUNSEL FOR THE GOVERNMENT FILED IN OPEN COURT A MOTION TO UNSEAL CASE, WHICH IS GRANTED BY THE COURT. THE COURT ORDERS THAT CASE BE UNSEALED AS TO ALL DEFTS. Defendant was provided with copy of the Indictment and advised as to his rights. Defendant will be represented by retain counsel, Fernando Carlo. Arraignment & Detention Hearing are set for 12/06/2010 at 9:00 AM before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin. (mn) Modified on 11/22/2010 to correct hearing date (cm). (Entered: 11/22/2010)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin: Arraignment and Detention Hearing as to Joel Vega-Berrios (15) was held on 11/29/2010. Deft waived the reading of the indictment. PONG 1s entered as to Counts 1, 2. Case is referred to Judge Perez-Gimenez for trial setting. The government argued for detention pending trial but was also heard as to possible conditions of release. Defense counsel requested release. Bail is set at $100,000 ($75,000 secured by cash or real property - no bonding co. - and $25,000 unsecured) with home detention, E/M, drug testing/treatment, employment, plus all other conditions as recommended by PTS. Deft shall surrender his firearm either to the PRPD or at a gun shop and shall submit evidence to the Probation Office. Deft shall be released once (1) secured bond is posted, (2) PTS is offered evidence of landline telephone at place of residence, and (3) PTS is offered evidence that deft surrendered his firearm. (AUSA Jenifer Hernandez. Atty Benito Rodriguez-Masso. PO Nancy Mendez. Court Reporter FTR. Court Interpreter Edna Brayfield.)(Hearing set for 8:45, held at 9:13-9:22.) (jm) (Entered: 11/29/2010)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Foster Hearing as to Rafael Fuentes-Miranda, Axel Ramos-Echeandia held on 11/15/2012. AUSA Jenifer Hernandez and defense counsel Luz M. Rios were present. The Court found defendants alert and competent to understand the proceedings. The Court advised the defendants as to any possible conflict that may arise in the future and advised of the rights to being represented by the same counsel. After having been admonished by the Court, both defendants agreed to be represented by the same counsel. Acknowledgment of Joint Representation Admonishment were signed by defendants and counsel. The same were approved by the Court. The Court found no probable conflict of interest at this time. Further Detention as to defendant Fuentes- Miranda, was held. Defense counsel requested that defendant's mother be qualified as third party custodian, instead of defendant's common-in-law wife. Defendant will be residing with his mother at all times. Having no objection by the Government, the Court granted the request and ordered the same. (Court Reporter FTR/bg.) Hearing set for 04:00. Hearing held at 05:32. Hearing ended at 05:41. Interpreter Felix Toledo. (br) (Entered: 11/26/2012)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Juan M Perez-Gimenez:Motion Hearing as to Carlos E. Rodriguez-Milian held on 6/26/2013 re Dkt. Nos. 1277 , 1288 1279 and 1278 : AUSA-Maria Montaez & Jenifer Hernandez and attorney Edwin Prado were present. Deft who is on bond was also present. Defense counsel stated his position regarding deft's pro-se motion for new counsel and his motion for withdrawal. The defendant also addressed the Court and stated that his request was due mainly to his financial situation and also because he received the govt's plea offer late. After hearing Atty Prado and the deft, the Court instructed them to meet and try to make amends, deft to file a Financial Affidavit and if he qualified then the Court would appoint Atty Prado to represent deft. Ruling on deft's pro-se Motion to modify electronic surveillance conditions (#1279) is held in abeyance pending USPO-Santana's position on the matter. (Court Reporter Zulma Ruiz.)Hearing set for 10:00.Hearing held at 10:55.Hearing ended at 11:30. (ja) (Entered: 06/28/2013)

Judgment of the Court as to counts 1, 2: Impr of 60 months as to counts | & 2 to be served concurrently with each other. SRT of 5 years as to counts 1 & 2 to be served concurrently with each other. SMA of $200.00. Monetary Laundering Forfeiture imposed pursuant to 18 U.S.C.  982(a)(1). Order of forfeiture and money judgment in the amount of $50,000.00 to be entered. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Juan M. Perez-Gimenez: Status Conference as to Eddy Brito-Martinez (4), Cesar Caballero-Collazo (19), Ysmael King- Almeida (22), Paulino Mejias-Garcia (30) held on 3/31/2015. AUSA Olga B. Castellon for AUSA Jenifer Y. Hernandez, and Joseph A. Boucher were present. Conference held as to the status of the fugitives. Co-defendant King-Almeida (22) was recently arrested, and was indicted in Cr. 15-189-02 (GAG). Counsel Boucher was granted a month to review and discuss the discovery with his client. Status Conference set for April 28, 2015 at 10:00 a.m. In regards co-defendant Caballero-Collazo (19), the United States informed as to the efforts been made to apprehend this fugitive. The United States was granted until July 1, 2015 to apprehend this defendant. In regards co-defendants Brito- Martinez (4), and Mejias-Garcia (30) both defendants are currently detained at the Dominican Republic. Extradition package submitted. The United States was granted ten (10) days to inform that due to defendant's circumstances, if they will pursue for their prosecution in this case. Status Conference set for 4/28/2015 10:00 AM for co- defendant King-Almeida (22). (Court Reporter Cindy Brown.)Hearing set for 10:00.Hearing held at 10:55.Hearing ended at 11:05. (om) (Entered: 04/02/2015)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Arraignment/Bail Hearings as to Ysmael King-Almeida (22) Count 1,2 held on 4/1/2015. SAUSA Glenn Goetchius and defense counsel Joseph Boucher were present. As to Arraignment, the Court finds defendant competent at this time. Defendant waived the reading of the Indictment. Plea of Not Guilty is entered. During the colloquy, the Court asked defendant if he understood what he was being charged and the maximum penalties, for defendant answered in the affirmative. Defense is granted seven (7) days to obtain discovery and fourteen (14) days thereafter to file all motions. The case is referred to the Judge for trial setting thereafter. As to Bail, defense counsel had nothing to offer. Defendant has an immigration detainer. The Government moved for detention. The Court ordered defendant detained without bail pending trial. (Court Reporter FTR/bg.) Hearing set for 09:00. Hearing held at 09:18. Hearing ended at 09:22. Interpreter Enith Valdes. (br) (Entered: 04/01/2015)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Juan M. Perez-Gimenez: Change of Plea Hearing as to Ysmael King-Almeida held on November 2, 2015. Present were AUSA Jenifer Y. Hernandez-Vega, court appointed counsel in Cr. 10-435-22 (PG), Joseph A. Boucher, and retained counsel in Cr. 15-189-2 (PG), Luz M. Rios-Rosario. Both cases were consolidated for plea and sentence purposes before Judge Perez- Gimenez. It was clarified at todays proceedings that counsel Boucher represents the defendant in Cr. 10-435-22 (PG) pursuant to the CJA, and in Cr. 15-189-02 (PG) until the day retained counsel Luz M. Rios Rosario filed her notice of appearance. The defendant was present in court, under the custody of the U.S. Marshals, and was assisted by the official court interpreter. The defendant was found competent to plea. Plea agreement and plea supplement filed in open court as to both cases Cr. 10-435-22 (PG), and Cr. 15-189-02 (PG). Plea of guilty entered by Ysmael King-Almeida as to Count One (1), and Two (2) in Cr. 10-435-22 (PG), and Count One (1) in Cr. 15-189-02 (PG). The defendant is to remain under the custody of the U.S. Marshals. A written Pre- sentence Report was ordered to be prepared by the United States Probation Office. Sentencing Hearing set for March 17, 2016 at 10:00 a.m. in Old San Juan Courthouse. (Court Reporter Cindy Brown.)Hearing set for 10:00.Hearing held at 10:59.Hearing ended at 11:49.
